src.inference.gateways.providers package¶

Submodules¶

src.inference.gateways.providers.azure module¶

Gateway-style MATH-500 inference for Azure-hosted DeepSeek-R1 (open-source).

Behavior: - Single-pass generation with the same math system prompt used in GRPO runs. - Writes JSONL to: {output_dir}/step{step:04d}_{split}.jsonl - Resumable: if a JSONL already exists, only missing sample_idx entries are

generated.

  • Uses Azure OpenAI (Responses API if available; falls back to Chat Completions).

This script is a specialized / legacy gateway runner. For canonical HF-based math evaluation, prefer src.inference.cli.unified_math using local checkpoints.

Usage (env-based auth):

export AZURE_OPENAI_ENDPOINT=”https://<resource>.openai.azure.com” export AZURE_OPENAI_API_KEY=”***” export AZURE_OPENAI_DEPLOYMENT=”deepseek-r1” # or your deployment name python -m src.inference.gateways.providers.azure –output_dir artifacts/results/deepseek-r1

src.inference.gateways.providers.azure.load_math500(cache_dir: str, split: str, seed: int, dataset_path: str | None = None)[source]¶

Thin wrapper that defers to the shared math-500 loader (monkeypatchable in tests).

src.inference.gateways.providers.azure.main() → None[source]¶

CLI entrypoint for single-pass Azure DeepSeek MATH-500 inference.

Returns:

None. The function parses arguments and runs the generation loop.

src.inference.gateways.providers.openrouter module¶

Gateway-style MATH-500 inference for DeepSeek-R1 via OpenRouter.

Behavior: - Single-pass generation with the same math system prompt used in GRPO runs. - Writes JSONL to: {output_dir}/step{step:04d}_{split}.jsonl - Resumable: if a JSONL already exists, only missing sample_idx entries are generated.

This script is a specialized / legacy gateway runner intended for remote API experiments. For canonical HF-based math evaluation, prefer src.inference.cli.unified_math.

Auth: - Expects an OpenRouter API key in the OPENROUTER_API_KEY env var.

Example usage:

export OPENROUTER_API_KEY=”sk-or-…” python -m src.inference.gateways.providers.openrouter

–output_dir artifacts/results/deepseek-r1-openrouter –model deepseek/deepseek-r1:free

src.inference.gateways.providers.openrouter.main() → None[source]¶

CLI entry point for generating DeepSeek-R1 samples via OpenRouter.

Returns:

None. The function parses arguments and runs the generation loop.

src.inference.gateways.providers.portkey module¶

Gateway-style MATH-500 inference via the Portkey AI Gateway (e.g., Princeton AI Sandbox).

Behavior: - Single-pass generation with the same math system prompt used in GRPO runs. - Writes JSONL to: {output_dir}/step{step:04d}_{split}.jsonl - Resumable: if a JSONL already exists, only missing sample_idx entries are

generated.

This script is a specialized / legacy gateway runner. For canonical HF-based math evaluation, prefer src.inference.cli.unified_math; use this module only when you need Portkey/sandbox-based remote models.

Auth: - Expects an API key in the AI_SANDBOX_KEY env var (Portkey key or sandbox

key).

Example usage:

export AI_SANDBOX_KEY=”***” python -m src.inference.gateways.providers.portkey –output_dir artifacts/results/gpt4o-math-portkey

class src.inference.gateways.providers.portkey.ExampleContext(problem: str, gold_answer: Any, canon_gold: Any, sample_idx: int)[source]¶

Bases: object

Per-example metadata for a MATH-500 row.

Parameters:

  • problem – Normalized problem text.

  • gold_answer – Ground-truth answer associated with the problem.

  • canon_gold – Canonicalized gold answer.

  • sample_idx – Sample index for this generation.

canon_gold: Any¶
gold_answer: Any¶
problem: str¶
sample_idx: int¶
class src.inference.gateways.providers.portkey.PortkeyCallResult(text: str, answer: str, finish_reason: Any, usage: Any)[source]¶

Bases: object

Result of a single Portkey generation call.

Parameters:

  • text – Raw model output text.

  • answer – Extracted answer text from the output.

  • finish_reason – Finish reason reported by the API.

  • usage – Optional usage object returned by the SDK.

answer: str¶
finish_reason: Any¶
text: str¶
usage: Any¶
class src.inference.gateways.providers.portkey.PortkeyRunConfig(output_path: str, split_name: str, model_name: str, num_samples: int, params: GatewayCallParams, seed: int, step: int)[source]¶

Bases: object

Configuration for a Portkey MATH-500 pass.

Parameters:

  • output_path – Path to the JSONL file where results are written.

  • split_name – Dataset split name (for example, "test").

  • model_name – Model identifier used via Portkey.

  • num_samples – Number of samples to generate per problem.

  • params – Generation parameters such as temperature and limits.

  • seed – Random seed for sampling and dataset shuffling.

  • step – Training or checkpoint step identifier for filenames.

model_name: str¶
num_samples: int¶
output_path: str¶
params: GatewayCallParams¶
seed: int¶
split_name: str¶
step: int¶
src.inference.gateways.providers.portkey.main() → None[source]¶

Parse arguments, load dataset, and run Portkey-based MATH-500 inference.

Returns:

None. The function parses CLI args and runs the main loop.

src.inference.gateways.providers.portkey.run_portkey_math_inference(client, dataset, existing: Dict[str, set], config: PortkeyRunConfig) → None[source]¶

Run single-pass math inference via Portkey and write JSONL results.

Parameters:

  • client – Portkey client created by _make_client().

  • dataset – Dataset object containing math problems and answers.

  • existing – Mapping from problem to already-filled sample indices.

  • config – Run configuration including output path and sampling options.

Returns:

None. Results are appended to the JSONL file.

Module contents¶

Provider implementations for remote math gateways.
